page.title: 06Arts in Ampleforth Village.
page.content: Quite a few people earn their living by using their skills to make things like rugs, walls or other stone works. There is a weaver (Mrs.Raynar), a potter (Mr.Raynar), a stone mason (Mr.Thompson) and two dry-stone wallers (Mr.Bradley and Mr.Barnett). {Mr.and Mrs.Raynar}are both fairly new at the trade, Mrs.Rayner starting only 3\ years ago, and Mr.Rayner just beginning this summer. {Mr.Thompson}has been at the art since he was three and is now a 'senior citizen'. He carves most things and often makes cartoons in stone. When we saw{Mr.Bradley}and{ {Mr.Barnett}they were repairing a pond in Colonel Gleadow's garden.They told us that building a stone wall was a slow job. It took us 20 minutes to make a 5 foot stretch of wall.
